oai_dc:dc.dc:title: THE INFLUENCE OF CURRENTS ON WAVE ATTENUATION
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Simons, Richard R.
Grass, Anthony J.
Kyriacou, Andreas
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: wave attenuation
current
wave/current interaction
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Measurements have been made of wave height decay in a rough bottomed flume for waves alone and for waves combined with 3 following currents. Tests have also been carried out to quantify energy dissipation at the sidewalls under these conditions. Results show that waves attenuate less rapidly when propagating on a following current, with a corresponding reduction in wave-current friction factor. A simple method is suggested by which wave attenuation in the presence of following and opposing currents can be predicted.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 21 (1988): Proceedings of 21st Conference on Coastal Engineering, Torremolinos, Spain, 1988.; 25
